item.title: Report X-2024080640
item.description:
Report X-2024080640

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill & exposure. Leaking box. One of 4x64oz plastic bottles Santeen Drain Cleaner lost 36oz from severe denting & loose cap closure. Spill occurred in spite of tape around caps & slotted partitions. Exposure: Package handler Jason Bowers, was exposed (skin contact on hands, no spotting or staining. Spillage released heat.) when attempting to remove package from IC belt. Package Handler Trainer Justin Hoeh had minor corrosion to undersides of shoes. Upon recommendation of Hoeh and Hall (DGNav reporter), the Work Area Manager ensured Bowers rinsed his hands for 10-15 min and continued follow up. Safety specialists have been notified.

item.title: Report X-2024081188
item.description:
Report X-2024081188

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-21T15:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-16
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill of battery acid. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT Labels or markings - not even "nonspillable"). Torn, leaking core box. 4oz loss of electrolyte/sulfuric acid from 15lb battery, Interstate /Traveller TS/IB-U1L300, from cracked nonspillable case. THIS IS A SPILL (despite the battery case being non-spillable variety)

item.title: Report E-2024080442
item.description:
Report E-2024080442

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 13, 2024, at 0907 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by XPO personnel in Memphis, Tennessee regarding the release of Lithium Hydroxide (UN2680, 8,II). Terminal personnel reported that 1 pound of material was released from (1) 60lb plastic bag due to being improperly prepared for transport and impacted the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned the release and placed it in a 15-gallon DF along with the damaged bag of residual product. The waste was then staged onsite pending disposal.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that the metal can inside spilled the contents inside of the fiberboard box. The bottom chime was damaged causing the release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024080867
item.description:
Report X-2024080867

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A shipment was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that one of the shipments had a release. The fiberboard box contained a metal can with a positive closure ring. The bottom chime was damaged causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
